children.name: li
children: : AD is vision and practice, but neither a theory nor a framework.

children.name: li
children: : ideas behind AD are neither novel nor unique, but known and even actively applied in software engineering for a long time, some for decades.

children.name: li
children: : AD is not suitable for every project and/or team.

children.name: li
children: : AD challenges software artisanry by reducing impact of subjectivity and human factor on core project activities.

children.name: li
children: : AD helps to marry requirements to deliverables by providing common ground for communication between stakeholders, analysts, QA, developers, and managers.

children.name: li
children: : AD doesn’t require any special fancy tooling and can work just fine with those common means used widely in development.

children.name: li
children: : AD can be easily enriched with simple custom-built tools to achieve more transparency and visibility through automation.
